p: Other examples of sustainable green polyesters are poly(glycolic acid) (PGA), poly(butylene succinate) (PBS), and poly-hydroxyalkanoates (PHA). PGA finds application in biomedicine owing to its ability to increase the biocompatibility and ductility of PLA, whereas PBS is typically used for film packaging [ 38, 39]; however, it has been proposed even for tissue engineering in combination with chitosan [ 40].
